channel.title: data bloomin science
channel.description: Recent content on data bloomin science

item.title: The Art of Small Data: How Much Fun is Surfing?
item.description: It is a peculiarity, perhaps, of the English language - certainly in its modern guise - that quite often the native speakers of ‘it’ are actually worse at ‘it’ than their second language counterparts. I can’t recall being taught any grammar in school - much of what I know about the rules of the language come from my father being such a pedant and from my brief time teaching English in Spain.

item.title: About
item.description: This site follows my journey through the murky world of tech. How did I end up here - a lifelong cyclist, sun-worshiper and surfer I find myself now in my 40’s sat at a desk staring at one, two, three screens. Sometimes it makes me curious, but mostly I just feel an over-riding sense of frustration.

item.title: Fool Me Once: F-ing Git
item.description: Website building in RStudio with Blogdown I’m a self-confessed luddite. 43 and never learnt to drive. I mostly get around by bicycle. I don’t have a telly, microwave, dishwasher, tumble dryer etc. I mow my lawn with this… This is all borne of a particular, peculiar individuality. Naturally, I’m an environmentalist, but I’m also prone to a state of inertia, stubborn, independent and cynical. How I ended up pursuing a career in tech is beyond me.
